Directus/Nuxt Boilerplate

Directus Admin

You can access the Directus admin via http://localhost:8055.

Default credentials

Email: admin@test.com

Password: password

Admin user

Once you are done with set up you should delete this user and replace with one of your own. Be aware it also contains an auth token to demonstrate the data retrieval.

Content

Add your content in clients/pages/index.vue.

Authentication

Directus/Nuxt uses a long lived access token to authenticate with Directus. This is fine for static websites and demonstration purposes but if your application requires secure login and/or role based authentication then you will need to update this. The simplest solution is to create a login procedure and then overwrite the runtime configuration value config.public.directusToken with the value you receive on login.

Retrieving data via Directus API

Although Directus provides a JS-SDK for retrieving data Directus/Nuxt uses a custom plugin that allows better integration with Nuxt's data retrieval composables. Use the Directus API reference to fetch data.

Below is an example fetch request from Directus:

const { $directus } = useNuxtApp()
  const { data: users } = await $directus('/users', {}) # The second parameter is a useFecth options object
[
  {
    "id": "d419a05f-d708-4ff6-8fb1-5f45963c8788",
    "first_name": "Admin",
    "last_name": "User",
    "email": "admin@test.com",
    "password": "**********",
    "location": null,
    "title": null,
    "description": null,
    "tags": null,
    "avatar": null,
    "language": null,
    "theme": "auto",
    "tfa_secret": null,
    "status": "active",
    "role": "f5d47ec9-1553-4a4b-abf0-bd1725d46cb4",
    "token": "UNSECURE_ACCESS_TOKEN",
    "last_access": "2022-05-11T14:33:44",
    "last_page": "/users",
    "provider": "default",
    "external_identifier": null,
    "auth_data": null,
    "email_notifications": true
  }
]

Deployment

You can update the location of the directus server by editing the clients/.env file.
